background.name: Lodge Berserker

_.special: A symbol of your berserker lodge

entries: 你加入了Rashemen的众多狂战士俱乐部之一，并被灌输为其重要的成员之一。成员们认为彼此是大家庭的一部分，只要有可能就会愉快地帮助他们的同伴。虽然传统上，外国人把所有拉舍马尔战士称为 "狂战士"，但在拉舍门内，只有狂战士俱乐部的成员才被视为狂战士。每个俱乐部都有自己的个性，通过他们的战斗风格和外观表现出来。俱乐部由他们自己的泰尔索尔保护，通常是与俱乐部名称相关的生物。每个俱乐部的成员都被编入 "獠牙"，这是一支精英战斗部队，随时准备响应铁王的号召，保卫国家。入会仪式因会所而异，但无一例外地要求展示战斗力，并完成各种测试，如通宵饮酒比赛或与会所的每个成员进行单手战斗。你是加入了一个大型的、知名的社团，还是加入了一个鲜有人知的小社团？不管是什么情况，大多数拉什马尔人都以尊重和钦佩的眼光看待你。

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: 一个你的狂暴者小屋的标志（例子包括大雄鹿小屋的鹿角，Ettercap小屋的网状绣布，或雪虎小屋的爪子项链），一套你精通的游戏装备，一套普通衣服，以及一个装有10GP的腰包。

entries.name: Lodge
entries: 虽然整个拉西门有许多狂战士的小屋，有些只有少数几个战士，但这些是一些最大和最知名的。你可以在下面的表格中滚动，从列表中选择一个小屋，或者创造你自己的小屋。

rows: 埃特卡普。这个小屋在奔流岩和高地上很受欢迎，因为那里的攀爬技能很有用。作为入会仪式的一部分，众所周知，他们让成员遭受各种生物的毒害。成员们经常穿着绣有蜘蛛或网络图案的布。
哥布林。在拉西门人口较多的地区很受欢迎，这个小屋以其游击战的战术而闻名。当进入战斗时，哥布林小屋的狂热者经常戴着皮革或毛皮制成的头罩。
大雄鹿。作为最大的社团之一，大雄鹿的成员往往是第一个冲锋陷阵的人，他们强行越过他们的盟友，向最大的敌人发起攻击。俱乐部成员通常携带由鹿角雕刻的物品。
冰雪巨魔。这个小屋被认为是最坚韧的小屋之一，其成员对自己能够承受敌人攻击的能力感到非常自豪。他们使用老人们制作的奇怪的灵药来强化自己的皮肤。当进入战斗时，冰雪巨魔小屋的成员经常将他们的脸涂成蓝色的阴影。
猫头鹰熊。这家旅馆以其对火酒、宴会和争吵的热爱而闻名。他们的大厅包括坚固的家具，可以承受他们频繁的暴力庆祝活动。他们的成员常常穿上镶有钉子的盔甲来加强他们的擒拿攻击。他们最伟大的战士身披猫头鹰羽毛装饰的斗篷。
雪虎。这种小而可怕的小屋以其强大的冲锋攻击而闻名。许多人在战斗时使用爪子的手镯，效果很好。他们的成员通常戴着项链、手镯，以及用捕食者的牙齿和爪子制作的符咒。
白龙。最古老和最大的住宿区之一，因其能够在拉舍门的严冬中生存而闻名。用龙鳞、龙牙和龙爪制成的武器和盔甲被最资深的成员虔诚地携带。
狼。这个受欢迎的小屋的成员擅长将他们的敌人扔到地上。这个俱乐部通常穿着狼皮制成的斗篷。

entries.name: Feature: Recognized Member
entries: 作为一个狂战士俱乐部的成员，大多数拉西门的普通人都以敬畏之心看待你。你的存在保证了拉舍马人对与你同行的任何外国同伴的有限接受。如果你来到一个有狂战士俱乐部大厅的社区，你和你的冒险同伴可以期待得到免费的食物和大厅内适度的住宿。

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: 狂暴战士俱乐部的成员陶醉于其战士文化。与成员和其他狂暴战士俱乐部的竞争被视为定义地位和荣誉的一种方式。虽然拉希米人不会支持角斗场，但在定居点定期举办体育比赛和斗殴比赛，参与者互相殴打以增加尊重和认可，这并不罕见。

rows: 我大声地表达我的意见，让所有人听到。
说话是浪费时间的。只有行动才能把事情做好。
如果我闲置的时间太长，我必须找到一种方法来释放我的侵略性。
即使在最困难的情况下，我也能控制自己的怒气。
我对自己所说和所做的一切都充满信心。
我对来自其他地方的人的习俗很着迷，并缠着他们告诉我他们来自哪里。
盛宴。饮酒。战斗。生活中没有更好的事情。
我爱我的武器。在那里，我说了。
荣誉。没有荣誉，我们就什么都不是（合法的）。
权力。最强大的人制定规则。众所周知。(邪恶)
自由。我们必须自由地追求自己的道路。(混沌)
更大的利益。当我们帮助有需要的人时，我们的小屋变得更大。(善)
人民。理想是毫无意义的字眼。我所关心的人是最重要的。(中立)
荣耀。通过战斗，我将为我的小屋和我自己赢得荣耀。(任意)
我的小屋就是我的家庭。没有什么比我俱乐部的人更重要。
我将成为整个拉舍门最伟大的狂战士。
红袍巫师杀了我所珍视的人。我将让他们付出代价。
当我们离开时，土地的精神将在这里。我们必须向他们表示敬意
拉舍曼女巫救了我的家人。我欠她们一条命。
风中有一个神秘的声音呼唤我去实现一个更大的目标。我将为我所遇到的所有人的生活带来改变。
我喜欢喝酒、宴请、打架，但我不知道什么时候该停下来。
如果你不是来自拉西门，你就不能被信任。
我愿意承担风险，即使会使他人处于危险之中。
我不能原谅任何轻视，并期待惩罚那些做了这些事的人。
弱者不值得我花费时间和精力。
我不需要制定计划，只有弱者才需要。

background.name: Wychlaran
entries: 你的奥术或神力标志着你与你周围的人不同。你们国家强大的女智者寻找你，让你加入他们的行列。你要么以未证实者的身份独自练习你的魔法能力，要么自愿加入女巫的行列，接受训练并成为她们的一员。当你选择这个背景时，请与你的管理员一起确定你是一个真正的巫师还是一个Durthan，你在这个行列中进展到什么程度，以及你有过什么样的经历。

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill History}，加上您从{@skill Arcana}、{@skill Insight}、{@skill Medicine}、{@skill Nature}和{@skill Religion}中选择的两项。

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: 草药学套装，一套普通和精美的衣服，一个面具，一块来自你认为神圣的地方的石头、树枝或树叶，以及一个装有15个金币的小包。

entries.name: Rank
entries: 在姐妹会中，有不同的等级，有不同的权力和责任。根据你的级别，你有具体的责任和经验。

rows: 未被证实的。那些选择不成为ethrans的人，或者也许没有进一步研究的倾向或能力。
伊瑟兰。一个低级的入门者，但仍然承担着作为一个巫师的全部责任和权力。
哈特兰。姐妹会的领导人。他们现在可以做错，他们的话就是法律。
Othlor. 最有智慧、最有经验的人。也许只有十几个人存在。
杜尔坦。一个被禁止的分裂团体，他们相信使用任何必要的手段来击败拉西门的敌人，包括使用被禁止的黑暗魔法。
前成员。你已经自愿离开秩序，或被要求离开。

entries.name: Spell List
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature}
作为维奇拉伦的一员，下列法术会被加入到你的法术等级的法术列表中。

entries.name: Feature: Position of Power
entries: 你与拉舍门的女智者的联系使你在你的土地之外有一定程度的权力。强大的奥术师和神职人员会给予你听众，偶尔也会给予你某种形式的援助，以换取你的青睐。

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: 你挥舞的魔法、威赫拉伦抚养你的故事，以及你在拉希曼人中所做的工作，都将你塑造成今天的你。

rows: 我在每个事件和行动中都看到了预兆。诸神试图对我们说话，我们只需要倾听。
我一听到最轻微的侮辱就会爆炸。
我相信所有值得做的事情都值得做得正确。我不能帮助它--我是一个完美主义者。
我对所有受苦的人感到极大的同情。
我确信人们总是试图窃取我的秘密。
我直言不讳地说出其他人的暗示或隐藏。
我愿意在做出自己的判断之前听取每一方的论点。
传统。崇拜和祭祀的古老传统必须得到保存和维护。(合法的)
权力。孤独和沉思是通往神秘或神奇力量的道路。(邪恶)
人。我致力于我关心的人，而不是理想。(中立)
命运。没有什么，也没有人可以引导我离开我更高的使命。(任何)
慈善。我总是试图帮助那些需要帮助的人，无论个人付出什么代价。(好)
自由。决不允许暴君压迫人民。(混沌)
我总有一天会向给我打上异教徒烙印的腐败等级制度报仇的。
我所做的一切是为了普通人。
为了证明自己比我讨厌的对手高明，我将不惜一切代价。
我保护那些不能保护自己的人。
那些站在我身边的人是值得为之牺牲的人。
我为那些不能为自己战斗的人而战。
我秘密地相信，如果我是一个统治土地的暴君，情况会更好。
我的思想和哲学是教条式的。
我愿意冒太大的风险去发掘一个失去的知识点。
我对任何不是经过验证的战士的人都不太尊重。
我对任何超越我的作品的人都有可怕的嫉妒心。无论我走到哪里，我都被对手包围着。
一旦有人质疑我的勇气，无论情况多么危险，我都不会退缩。

_.special: twig or leaf from a place you consider sacred

feat.name: Inspired Protector
entries: 每长时休息一次，你可以花10分钟时间与你选择保护的一个盟友进行防御演习。在这10分钟结束时，你获得一种有限的能力，可以使用战士的（%0%）和（%1%）战斗风格来保护该盟友。你可以使用每一种战斗方式两次，再加上与所选盟友的魅力修饰值相等的额外次数（最少1）。
这种保护盟友的能力一直持续到所选盟友的命中率降至零或你完成一次长时休息为止。

feat.name: Lodge Berserker
entries: 你达到了拉希门的一个狂暴者营地的严格要求。紧张的训练提高了你的战斗能力。

items: 选择下面的一个狂暴者小屋，并获得该小屋的好处。
{@i {@b Ettercap Lodge.}}你在所有的攀爬能力检查中都有优势。愤怒时，你对毒药的救赎有优势，并且对毒药伤害有抵抗力。
{@i {@b Goblin Lodge.}} 愤怒时，如果你用近战攻击击中一个生物，你可以采取脱离行动作为额外行动。
{@i {@b Great Stag Lodge.}} 愤怒时，如果你在进行近战攻击前在一条直线上移动至少10英尺，你在攻击上就有优势。
{@i {@b Ice Troll Lodge.}} 愤怒时，你的AC增加1
{@i {@b Owlbear Lodge.}}当愤怒并抓捕一个生物时，你会在你的回合开始时自动对被抓捕的生物造成相当于你的熟练度加成的打击性伤害。
{@i {@b Snow Tiger Lodge.}} 愤怒时，如果你在用近战攻击击中目标之前在一条直线上移动至少10英尺，你会造成相当于你熟练度加成三倍的额外伤害。你必须在完成短暂或长时间的休息后才能再次使用此功能。这个小屋的狂暴者以在战斗中使用爪形手镯（第122页）而闻名。
{@i {@b White Dragon Lodge.}}你在所有的能力检查中都有优势，可以在雪地和冰面上移动。愤怒时，你对寒冷的判断有优势，并且你对寒冷的伤害有抵抗力。
{@i {@b Wolf Lodge.}} 愤怒时，如果你用近战攻击击中一个目标，该目标必须做一个力量救赎动作，否则就会被打倒在地。你蓄力的DC等于8+你的熟练度加成+你的力量修正值。你可以使用这个功能的次数与你的熟练度加成相等。在完成短时或长时休息后，你将重新获得该功能的所有使用权。
当你的等级提高时，你可以加入一个新的狂战士小屋。如果你这样做了，就用新社团的功能取代你的旧社团所授予的功能。

feat.name: Magic Initiate (Wychlaran)
entries: 你已经学会了一些巫师的魔法；这种魔法在拉西门的时候会得到加强。

items: 你可以从维奇拉伦的法术列表中选择学习一个咒语和一个一级法术。智慧是你对这些法术的施法能力。
你可以在没有法术槽的情况下施放此特技的一级法术。在你再次以这种方式施放之前，你必须完成一次长时间的休息。你也可以使用你拥有的任何法术槽来施展该法术。
在Rashemen时，每长时间休息一次，你可以施放wychlaran法术表中的任何一级法术。智慧是你对这个法术的施法能力。如果你在施放这个法术的时候是属于维奇拉伦的集体束缚，那么这个法术可以在2级的时候施放。

feat.name: Rashemi Elemental Summoning
entries: 你与拉希门的元素精神的联系使你能够在需要的时候召唤它们。
当你施展一个允许你召唤空气或土元素的法术时，你可以选择召唤一个（%0%）或（%1%）来代替。
任何允许你转化为元素的法术、魔法效果或其他功能，现在都可以把你变成（%0%）或（%1%）。

feat.name: Runescarring
entries: 你已经学会了一种古老的技术，包括烧毁法术卷轴并将灰烬制成膏药。将神奇的灰烬涂抹在针或刀上，用来给生物纹身或留下疤痕，使它们具有施法的能力。要做到这一点，你必须成功地从一个法术卷轴中施放一个法术。在咒语生效之前，你要花一小时将卷轴化为灰烬并准备好混合物。然后你必须在每个法术等级花一小时将其应用于生物。这个过程可以被认为是长时间休息时的轻度活动，你可以根据需要多次停止和开始来完成它。
一旦纹身完成，持有者可以用宪法作为他们的法术修改器施展一次法术，之后魔法就会消失。
一个没有被激活的完整的疤痕或纹身可以通过检测魔法咒语和类似的方法被检测到是有魔法的，根据咒语的魔法流派散发出一种光环。此外，它还可以用驱散魔法咒语和类似的效果来消除。

trait.name: Dual Minded
entries: 巨魔在抵抗变成的拯救动作上有优势（%0%）。

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: 巨魔在依靠视觉、听觉或嗅觉的智慧（（%0%））检查中具有优势。

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: 巨魔在其回合开始时重新获得10点生命值。如果巨魔受到酸或火的伤害，它在下一回合开始时只能恢复5点生命值。只有当巨魔被造成10或更多酸或火伤害的攻击击中时，巨魔才会死亡，此时巨魔的命中率为0。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 巨魔会进行五次攻击：一次用抓取，四次用咬或爪子。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7})穿刺伤害加上11 ({@damage 2d8})中毒伤害，如果目标被巨魔{@condition grappled}。

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7})砍击伤害。

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw}{@hit 12}击中，到达10英尺，一个没有被巨魔{@condition grappled}的生物。{@h}目标被巨魔{@condition grappled}(逃脱{@dc 20})。直到这个抓捕结束，目标被{@condition restrained}。巨魔最多可以让两个生物以这种方式（%7%）。当它这样做时，它不能再用爪子进行攻击，直到它有一个或更少的生物（%8%）。
一个倒下的巨魔的庞大框架承受着两个巨大头颅的重量。每张脸都是扭曲的，但却长着巨魔无可置疑的长鼻子。这些生物有时被称为巨大的双头巨魔，如果一个冒险者对这种生物的唯一认识是：大块头和双头，那么他可能会被误认为是艾丁。
巨魔的灰绿色皮肤圆鼓鼓的，很厚；外面包着巨魔找到的任何大的死物，足以让它缓解咬人的昆虫和寒风的侵袭。从它们头上垂下的长长的头发状的皮肤条，似乎从未停止过移动。
{@b {@i Glacier Trolls.}}堕落巨魔的一个变种存在于拉西门边界以外的地区，但在伊塞林山脉的山脚下发现它也不足为奇。这种变种对火的影响免疫，使它们成为一种独特的难以隐藏的生物。

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: 冰龙可以呼吸空气和水。

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: 冰龙可以在冰冷的表面上移动和攀爬，而不需要进行能力检查。此外，由冰或雪组成的{@quickref difficult terrain||3}不需要花费它的额外移动。

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: 如果冰龙的拯救动作失败，它可以选择成功。

trait.name: Underwater Invisibility
entries: 龙的奇特轮廓的透明鳞片使它在水下无法被发现。当完全浸泡在水中时，龙是（%0%）。

trait.name: Web Claws
entries: 龙的手指间有蹼，使它可以比它的体型更快游泳。该龙的游泳速度为+10（包括上述）。
九百多年前，由于秘密教派试图推翻教团并控制拉舍曼，杜尔坦人和维奇兰人之间的纷争爆发了。虽然杜尔坦人被赶走了，但他们在蒂鲁拉格湖底留下了一个可怕的遗产。在DR595，杜尔坦姐妹抓住了一颗白龙蛋，并在它身上施展了强大的魔法，用强大的咒语改造了蛋壳中的生物。尽管她们的希望落空，但她们知道与维奇拉伦对手的战斗不会在一代人中结束，这些有远见的人
叛军为一个强大的盟友奠定了基础，以帮助他们的后代夺取拉西门的未来。
在蒂尔古拉格湖底，白龙成长起来，它是同类中独一无二的变异体，后来被称为冰龙。它是一种具有强大冰冷气息的野兽，其鳞片使它在水下几乎看不见。拉舍门的精神守护者试图引诱波浪下的英雄们去杀死它。
但那些敢于挑战的人总是失败。近一千年来，冰龙一直在等待，收集财宝和力量，等待时机，最终对维奇拉伦和他们的盟友发动攻击。现在它已经完全成熟了，冰龙终于开始蠢蠢欲动。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 龙可以使用它的 "恐怖的存在"。然后它进行三次攻击：一次是咬，两次是爪子。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14}击中，到达15英尺，一个目标。{@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8})穿刺伤害加上9 ({@damage 2d8})寒冷伤害。

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}19 ({@damage 2d6 + 8})砍击伤害。

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14}击中，到达20英尺，一个目标。{@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8})重击伤害。

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: 每一个在龙的120英尺范围内并知道它的生物，必须在一个{@dc 16}的智慧救赎上成功，否则会变成{@condition frightened}，持续1分钟。生物可以在它的每个回合结束时重复蓄力，如果成功则结束对它的影响。如果一个生物的蓄力动作成功或效果结束，该生物在接下来的24小时内对龙的恐怖存在免疫。

action.name: Ice Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: 龙在90英尺的范围内呼出一股冰冷的气流。该区域内的每个生物都必须做一个{@dc 22}体质救赎，如果救赎失败，将受到72({@damage 16d8})的寒冷伤害，如果救赎成功，将受到一半的伤害。如果龙在水下使用冰息，90英尺范围内的生物必须做一个{@dc 15}力量救赎，否则会变成{@condition incapacitated}，在救赎失败时被包裹在厚厚的冰层中，或者在救赎成功时速度降低一半；对寒冷伤害有抵抗力或免疫的生物不会降低速度。冰层有AC13和18个打击点。被困在冰层中的生物可以通过一个行动来挣脱，并在一个{@dc 15}的力量检查中取得成功。

legendary.name: Detect
entries: 龙做一个智慧（感知）检查。

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: 龙做了一个尾巴攻击。

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: 龙拍打它的翅膀。在龙的15英尺范围内的每个生物都必须在一个{@dc 22}灵巧的投掷中成功，或者受到15({@damage 2d6 + 8})的打击伤害并被击倒{@condition prone}。然后龙可以飞到其飞行速度的一半。

trait.name: Fast Movement
entries: 在不穿重甲的情况下，巫师野蛮人的速度增加10（包括在统计数字中）。

trait.name: Fiendish Heritage
entries: 妖怪对只影响人类的法术效果免疫。

trait.name: Reckless
entries: 在它的回合开始时，巫妖可以在它在该回合内所做的所有近战武器攻击卷上获得优势，但对它的攻击卷有优势，直到它下一回合开始。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 巫师野蛮人用近战武器攻击两次。

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5}击中，达到5英尺一
目标。{@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3})砍击伤害。

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5}击中，到达30/120英尺，一个目标。{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3})穿刺伤害。
妖精是被抛弃的妖精的后代。被他们的母亲所憎恨，被人类所抛弃，女巫是被留在这个将他们视为洪水猛兽的世界中生存的顽强生命。
{@b {@i Wanderers without a homeland.}}鹰身人是一种非常孤独的生物。有些人由她们的巫师母亲短期抚养，然后被送入世界。还有一些在出生时就被遗弃；这些弃儿由他们的养父母抚养，但女巫和人类都憎恨鹰身人，让他们在这个世界上独自行动。
{@b {@i Strong and resilient.}}从女巫的父母那里继承了强大的力量和邪恶的本性，女巫的身体很强大。他们勇敢而坚韧，拥有坚韧的皮肤和巨大的身体资源。
{@b {@i Capable of great deeds.}}即使是那些不顾巫师的人类，也会同意这些生物能够拥有传奇般的武器。心胸宽广的人听了这些传说，在他们遇到的每一个巫师身上看到了巨大的潜力。如果有机会证明自己，巫妖更有能力成为值得信赖和强大的盟友。

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: Hornclaw在依靠视觉或嗅觉的智慧（（%0%））检查中具有优势。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 角爪会进行两次攻击：一次用喙，一次用爪子。

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw}{@hit 13}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9})的砍击伤害，目标是{@condition grappled}（逃跑{@dc 21}）。直到这个抓捕结束，目标是{@condition restrained}，角爪不能对另一个目标使用它的爪子
阿申伍德的领主，一些拉希米人说，森林属于灰熊霍恩克劳，一只古老的猫头鹰。如果传说中的冰龙是湖泊的统治者，那么霍恩克劳就是林地的统治者。
Hornclaw是一只史诗级的猫头鹰熊。他的体型可与巨人相媲美，他在自己的领地上蹒跚而行，所有的挑战者都遭到了灭顶之灾。不知道这头野兽是如何活了这么久的，但许多人认为它是很久以前由巫师强化的生物。女巫们失去了对它的控制，她们的魔法使这个生物成长为龙人的比例，寿命也与之相符。
灰袍人Hornclaw的传说已经传到了希望获得巨额报酬的怪物猎人的耳朵里。有几支队伍正在集结，准备进入灰林，活捉这个怪物，交给富有的赞助人。目前还不知道是谁在资助这些探险队，但与拉希曼的传言指向了（正如他们经常做的那样）泰伊。这样的事情并不奇怪，因为泰伊族的巫师可能能够理解维克拉伦的魔法，以及他们是如何将这样的力量赋予这头野兽的。
那些试图抓捕灰袍人Hornclaw的人是在为他们的生命而战。在Ashenwood游荡和居住了几十年后，林地的精灵们帮助Hornclaw对付任何伤害他的人。

items: 当活着的咒语被神圣化时，它具有以下特征。
如果活体法术会从单一来源受到少于20点的坏死伤害，它反而会失去1点命中率；或者，如果来源是一个法术，它反而会失去与法术等级相等的命中率（至少1点）。
如果活体法术会从单一来源受到20或更多的坏死伤害，它就会变成腐化（见腐化形态特质）。
活体法术对辐射伤害免疫。
当活着的法术被腐蚀时，它有以下特征。
活体法术失去了所有的免疫力，并获得对坏死性伤害的免疫力。
如果活体法术会从单一来源受到少于20的伤害，它反而会失去1点命中率；或者，如果来源是法术，它反而会失去与法术等级相等的命中率（至少1）。
如果活体法术会受到来自单一来源的20或更多的辐射伤害，它就会变成圣化（见圣化形态特质）。

trait.name: Draining Spirit (Corrupted Form Only)
entries: 当一个生物移动到活体法术所占据的空间，或活体法术移动到另一个生物所占据的空间，该生物会失去{@damage 1d6}的命中率，而活体法术会获得1点命中率。生物在下一回合开始前不能再次受到这种伤害。这个特性对构造物和不死生物没有影响。

trait.name: Healing Spirit (Sanctified Form Only)
entries: 当一个生物移动到活体法术所占据的空间，或活体法术移动到另一个生物所占据的空间，该生物会恢复（%0%）的命中率，而活体法术会失去1点命中率。生物在下一回合开始前不能再次获得这种治疗。这个特性对构造物或不死生物没有影响。

trait.name: Magical Form
entries: 活体法术不能恢复命中率或获得临时的命中率，除非是用它的持续行动或耗尽精神的特性。如果活体法术是驱散魔法或类似魔法的目标，它失去的命中率等于所施法术的法术等级（最低为1）。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 愈合的灵魂在面对法术和其他魔法效果时有优势。

trait.name: Spirit Movement
entries: 活体法术可以在其他生物中移动，就像它们是困难的地形一样。

action.name: Sustain (Sanctified Form Only)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6}击中，范围60英尺，一个目标。{@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4})坏死伤害，活体法术恢复1点生命值。
大多数活体法术都是学者型施法者的实验产物，或者是与织网或其他原始魔法的涌动有关的随机事件。没有哪个事件像法术瘟疫那样广泛，因此而产生的活体法术的数量是惊人的。它们不再是只在巫师塔楼和巫师墓穴的大厅里被发现的罕见遭遇。这种东西可以被发现在任何古老森林的树丛中游荡，在夜空中穿行，或者只是做这种法术会做的事，如果它是由一些艺术大师变出来的。
大多数活着的法术都是奥术性质的，但牧师和德鲁伊的神圣法术也不排除这种可能性。愈合的灵魂法术是一个特别可能的候选者，因为它在被施放后会持续存在。这些灵体并不是恶意的。它们的出现就像虚无缥缈的海绿色旋风，只是在树木间旋转，用它们的治疗魔法触摸那些受伤的人。对于生活在树丛中的生物来说，即使有一个这样的精灵也是一种祝福。
尽管他们看起来是利他主义的奇思妙想，但他们也不能避免受到外来者的影响。在大峡谷的邓伍兹中，恶魔的污点在那里的精灵身上留下了伤痕--将他们腐蚀成了曾经的变态。这种堕落可以发生在恶性能量凝聚的任何地方，人们应该被警告不要在他们附近召唤负能量。

trait.name: Air Form
entries: orglash可以进入一个敌对生物的空间并停在那里。当敌方生物在orglash的空间内时，他们会被（%0%）和严重遮蔽。orglash可以在一个1英寸宽的狭窄空间内移动而不被挤压。

trait.name: Coalescing Chill
entries: 如果orglash至少有1个命中率并且处于极度寒冷的状态，它在回合开始时就会恢复5点命中率。

trait.name: Fire Susceptibility
entries: 如果orglash在产生热量的明火的5英尺范围内开始它的回合，它会受到5点火的伤害。此外，每当orglash从法术或攻击中受到火系伤害时，它会受到额外的10火系伤害。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: orglash进行两次猛烈的攻击。

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5})重击伤害加上4 ({@damage 1d8})寒冷伤害。

action.name: Whiteout {@recharge 5}
entries: 在orglash的空间里的每个生物都必须做一个{@dc 14}宪法救赎，如果救赎失败会受到16({@damage 3d8 + 3})的寒冷伤害，如果救赎成功会受到一半的伤害。
如果救赎失败5次或更多，该生物也会获得（%0%）的等级。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: orglash与生俱来的法术能力是 "魅力"（法术救赎（%0%））。orglash可以施展以下法术，不需要任何组件。

entries: 这些寒冰旋风又被称为冰灵，原产于拉舍门地区。它们是居住在山峰、冰洞和雪地上的独居生物。奥格拉什与拉希门的土地息息相关，并坚定地保护它免受来自外部和内部的威胁。
尽管是一种完全的魔法生物，但与许多其他的元素生物不同，orglash是原产于物质界的。这种自然的生理结构使它无法在温暖的气候中生存。当一个orglash被杀死时，它会留下一块冰元素的碎片。如果orglash在死前的最后一分钟受到了火的伤害，那么这块碎片会立即融化。冰元素碎片可以被贴在施法的焦点上，允许持有者在他们施放的法术所造成的冷伤害上重新选择1和2。
拉舍门寒冷的水面上隐藏着无数的精灵，包括经常孤独的鲁索卡。这些精灵与水体结合在一起，其范围从一个小池塘到大河或湖泊都有。通常情况下，它们是孤独的个体，然而，偶尔会有一个小鸽子居住在一个特别有魔力的地方。
{@b {@i Seductive Forms.}}在Rashemen的狂热者旅馆里讲的许多故事表明，Rusalka是溺水少女的灵魂，她们引诱男人走向水深火热。然而，事实是它们是无性别的精灵，它们的外表可以变化，尽管不清楚鲁萨卡的形态是否会随着自己或观众的欲望而变化。一些人可以证明他们遇到了不同性别的鲁萨卡，但在所有情况下，观察者都描述了一个诱人的个体。
{@b {@i Enchanting Song.}}卢萨卡的声音充满了强大的费伊人的魅力，他们用自己迷人的旋律来诱惑凡人加入他们。媚族学者认为，鲁萨卡诱骗个人是为了缓解水底的深深的孤独感，善良的媚族用他们的自然魔法给他们的目标灌输水下呼吸的能力。这并不能解释邪恶的鲁萨卡的动机，他们已经知道诱使许多凡人进入水的坟墓。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: 鲁索卡与生俱来的法术能力是魅力（法术保存（%0%））。它可以先天性地施展以下法术，不需要任何物质成分。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 鲁萨卡在对抗法术和其他魔法效果时有优势。

trait.name: Place Bound
entries: 每当鲁萨卡离它们被束缚的水体超过一英里时，它们就会受到一级（%0%）的影响。

trait.name: Strength of the Waters
entries: 当接触到湖泊、河流或溪流等自然水体时，鲁萨卡在所有的力量、灵巧和体质检查及蓄力方面都有优势。

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: 鲁索卡可以呼吸空气和水。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 鲁萨卡会进行两次近战攻击。

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw}{@hit 5}击中，距离5英尺或范围20/60英尺，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Beguiling Song
entries: 鲁萨卡唱出一段神奇的旋律，目标是300英尺内它能看到的、能听到这首歌的单个人形或巨人。目标必须在智慧救赎中成功，否则就会受到1%的影响，直到歌曲结束。鲁萨卡必须在随后的回合中采取额外行动来继续唱歌。它可以在任何时候停止唱歌。如果鲁萨卡是{@condition incapacitated}，歌声就会结束。

当目标在鲁萨卡身边时，目标会被{@condition charmed}，并且忽略其他生物的歌曲。如果{@condition charmed}目标与鲁萨卡的距离超过5英尺，目标必须在它的回合中通过最直接的路线向鲁萨卡移动，试图进入5英尺之内。它不能避免机会攻击，但在进入破坏性地形之前，例如熔岩或深坑，以及每当它受到来自rusalka以外的伤害时，目标可以重复拯救动作。3%）的目标也可以在它的每个回合结束时重复该蓄力动作。如果救赎成功，效果就会在它身上结束。
成功救治的目标在接下来的24小时内对这个鲁萨卡的歌声免疫。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: 沙特詹的先天法术能力
是智慧（法术保存（%0%））。它可以先天性地施展
以下法术，不需要任何物质成分。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Shatjan在面对法术和其他魔法效果的时候，有优势。

bonus.name: Cold Aura
entries: 作为一个额外的动作，沙特詹人将自己包围在一个寒冷的光环中。任何在shatjan的10英尺范围内开始其回合的生物都会受到5({@damage 2d4})的寒冷伤害。shatjan可以在任何时候解除这个光环而不需要使用行动。如果shatjan变成{@condition incapacitated}，则光环结束。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 沙特詹做出一次长矛攻击和一次血肉攻击。

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4}命中，射程5英尺或范围20/60英尺，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2})穿刺伤害，如果用双手使用，则为6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2})穿刺伤害。如果目标是一个生物，它必须在一个{@dc 12}的力量救赎中成功，或者被击倒{@condition prone}。

action.name: Frost Breath
entries: shatjan以5英尺内的生物为目标，吹出一股冷空气。目标必须在一个{@dc 13}体质救赎中成功，如果救赎失败，将受到10({@damage 3d6})的寒冷伤害，如果救赎成功，将受到一半的伤害。
沙特詹是精灵守护者，他们在北国寒冷荒凉的土地上看护着成群的驯鹿。这些生物拥有驯鹿的头颅和健壮的人形。他们的头部、肩部和大部分前臂都覆盖着一层厚厚的黑毛，他们喜欢穿用兽皮和树皮制作的衣服，上面装饰着简单的图案和符号。
{@b {@i Nomadic Protectors.}}沙特人通常是独居的，在驯鹿每年穿越寒冷的北方土地的迁徙过程中跟随驯鹿，以与他们所照顾的鹿群一样的食物为生。夏天，他们聚集成小部落，用树皮和树枝搭建小型圆顶庇护所。在冬季，个体跟随驯鹿在冰洞或简单的藏身处休息。
{@b {@i Warriors of the Cold.}}沙特詹人与土地紧密相连，了解猎物与捕食者之间的平衡需要。当牛群的健康受到威胁时，他们会保护自己的牛群不被过于凶猛的捕食者伤害。
{@b {@i Human Relations.}}北方的纳尔和拉谢米部落都认为Shatjan是土地的强大保护者，对精灵的态度是尊重和敬畏。大多数人认为遇到沙特詹人是好兆头，在狩猎开始前都会为该地区的任何沙特詹人留下祭品。众所周知，沙特詹人曾与人类进行交易，提供在他们寒冷的北方土地上无法获得的稀有蔬菜美味。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: 巫婆的法术能力是
魅力（法术拯救（%0%））。她可以先天性地施展
以下法术，不需要任何物质成分。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 巫婆在面对法术和其他魔法效果时，在蓄力攻击上有优势。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 女巫进行三次爪子攻击。如果前两次攻击命中，并且三次攻击都是针对同一个目标，那么第三次爪击就会自动成为关键一击。她可以用 "尖叫 "来代替第三次爪击。

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}击中，到达5英尺，一个生物。{@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5})砍击伤害。

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: 女巫发出可怕的、令人发狂的尖叫声。任何在女巫60英尺范围内的生物都必须成功地进行一次{@dc 14}宪法救赎，如果救赎失败，将受到22({@damage 4d10})的雷霆伤害，如果救赎成功，将受到一半的伤害。
尖叫的巫婆是一种可怕的、可恶的生物。类似于一个高大的女人，常常装饰着颓废或奢华的珠宝或服装，好像它在过去拥有某种辉煌的地位。他们的皮肤是黄褐色的，厚实而皮实，手上长着铁质的爪子。他们的白色长发四处飘扬，仿佛被困在寒冷的北风中。
尖叫的巫婆最喜欢的事情莫过于欺骗那些有美德或强烈道德信念的人，让他们在不知不觉中做出可怕的行为。这些阴谋往往被设计成造成混乱，把注意力从他们的逃亡中引开。一旦被抓到，她们就会飞快地大发雷霆，试图在逃亡中造成尽可能多的死亡或破坏。
{@b {@i Wandering Terrors.}}尖叫的女巫喜欢在凡间旅行，在前往下一个猎场之前制造纷争。它们很少呆在原地，像微风一样在平原上飘荡。
{@b {@i Masters of the Wind.}}凭借他们与生俱来的法术和飞行能力，尖叫的女巫是非常难以捉摸的。在拉舍门，据说恶风会带来看不见的危险。女巫们喜欢轻装上阵，她们的大部分财产是珠宝或衣服。
{@b {@i Crone Canes.}}每个尖叫的女巫都拥有一根法杖、手杖或拐杖，虽然他们不需要，但这是他们亲自制作和长期发展的极其私人的物品。对于老巫婆来说，这件物品上可能密布着宝石、贵重金属、骨头，或者其他巫婆喜欢和收集的东西。

trait.name: Regal Presence
entries: 猿猴灵兽有一个光环，延伸到120英尺。在这个区域内的野兽不能被强迫做出违背其本性的行为。在这个区域的野兽不会对猿猴精神兽选择的生物做出攻击性的行动。如果有必要，这个区域的野兽会用他们的生命来保护猿猴精神兽。在这个区域内的野兽会在它们的攻击和蓄力上增加+3。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 猿猴进行了两次拳头攻击。

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}26 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}
+ {@dice 3d12})重击伤害。

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8}击中，范围25/50英尺，一个目标。{@h}26 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}{@dice  + 3d12})重击伤害。
当自然界的精神感到有必要与世界上那些听从他们的动作的人联系时，就会选择一个有代表性的野兽，并增强其在其他世界的能力，并将其变成巨大的版本。
{@b {@i Regents of the Spirit World.}}这些巨大的野兽被自然界中的其他生物视为国王和王后，受到祝福和被选中。掠夺性动物在灵兽面前时，不会对灵兽或其他野兽采取攻击性行动。
{@b {@i Authoritative Representation.}}大自然本身会对灵兽的情绪、想法和奇想做出反应。当灵兽生气时，天空会变暗，雷声会荡漾。灵兽的死亡通常会伴随着几天的自然哀伤。
{@b {@i Wandering Lair.}}在任何自然区域进行短期或长期休息后，自然界开始重新配置以适应灵兽。野猪灵兽可能会有泥沼的形态，而曼陀罗灵兽则发现树木改变了形状，变得更容易攀爬。这个巢穴通常充满了更多同类型的野兽，以及许多chwingas。

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: 牧师是一个5级的施法者。它的法术能力是智慧（法术救赎（%0%），用法术攻击命中率+5）。牧师准备了以下牧师法术。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: 山灵民的先天法术能力是智慧（法术救赎（%0%），用法术攻击命中率+5）。它可以先天性地施展以下法术，不需要任何物质成分。

trait.name: Charm Animals and Plants (1/day)
entries: 牧师30英尺范围内的每只野兽或植物都必须在{@dc 13}智慧救赎中成功，或者在1分钟内被牧师{@condition charmed}，或者直到它受到伤害。

trait.name: Daring Athlete
entries: 在陡峭的山坡、陡峭的边缘、狭窄的小路或其他多山或险恶的地形上，山灵在所有灵巧或力量的检查上都有优势。

trait.name: Expert Climber
entries: 山灵人在攀登时对所有力量（运动）的检查都有优势。

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw}{@hit 5}击中，到达5英尺或范围20/60，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2}击中，达到30/120英尺，一个目标。{@h}({@dice 1d6})穿刺伤害。
灵民是人类和守护神祖先的后代。他们很罕见，最常在山区或河床附近发现。
{@b {@i At home in two worlds.}}灵族人与自然环境有着密切的关系。作为拉西门守护神的后裔，他们在自然界或这个地区的小城镇中同样感到自在。
{@b {@i Serene and wise.}}那些遇到灵媒的人经常说他们对生活充满了喜悦。灵族人深深地参与到生活中，并将自己视为扎根于世界，属于世界，而不是与世界相悖。这片大陆唤起了他们所遇到的人的羡慕和钦佩之情。
{@b {@i Long lived travellers.}}灵族可以活到400岁。在他们漫长的生命中，有些人直接与人类世界打交道，生活在社区中，充当当地神的神职人员或受信任的议员。为了避免变得过于依赖，大多数灵民只在一个人类世代的居住地停留一段时间，然后离开，去寻找一个他们可能做出贡献的新家。
尽管它们的体型相对较小，但这些生物的体型却令人印象深刻，并带有一种支配性的气息。泰尔把法鲁恩北部的山区当作自己的家，从世界之脊一直向东到拉舍门北部的伊塞林山脉。关于蓝毛山地野兽像雪崩一样下山袭击小哨所和村庄的神话经常提到泰尔，但像所有的神话一样，包含了相当一部分创造性的强调。当塔尔人袭击村庄时，他们会带走牲畜和物资--如毛毯、工具和木材--这些资源是他们在冰川山脉中无法获得的。
他们的社会由不超过两代人的家庭豆荚组成。通常情况下，一旦泰尔人达到可以生育的年龄，他们的父母就会离开，在荒原上漫游，或者捡拾他们留给孩子的礼物，以确保有限的资源被分配给最有前途的一代。每个豆荚通常至少有一个神职人员，一个与奥里尔（Auril）或在极少数情况下与洛菲塔尔（Loviatar）有关的精神领袖。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 泰尔会进行两次近战武器攻击。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4})穿刺伤害加上5 ({@damage 2d4})寒冷伤害。

action.name: Great Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4})重击伤害。

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6}击中，范围60/240英尺，一个目标。{@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4})重击伤害。
尽管它们的体型相对较小，但这些生物的体型却令人印象深刻，并带有一种支配性的气息。泰尔把法鲁恩北部的山区当作自己的家，从世界之脊一直向东到拉舍门北部的伊塞林山脉。关于蓝毛山地野兽像雪崩一样下山袭击小哨所和村庄的神话经常提到泰尔，但像所有的神话一样，包含了相当一部分创造性的强调。当塔尔人袭击村庄时，他们会带走牲畜和物资--如毛毯、工具和木材--这些资源是他们在冰川山脉中无法获得的。
他们的社会由不超过两代人的家庭豆荚组成。通常情况下，一旦泰尔人达到可以生育的年龄，他们的父母就会离开，在荒原上漫游，或者捡拾他们留给孩子的礼物，以确保有限的资源被分配给最有前途的一代。每个豆荚通常至少有一个神职人员，一个与奥里尔（Auril）或在极少数情况下与洛菲塔尔（Loviatar）有关的精神领袖。

action.name: Frostbite (Cantrip)
entries: 在60英尺范围内的一个生物必须做一个{@dc 14}的宪法救赎动作。如果救赎失败，目标会受到3({@damage 1d6})的寒冷伤害，并且他们在下一回合结束前进行的下一次武器攻击卷轴上有劣势。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 泰尔会进行两次近战武器攻击。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1})穿刺伤害加上2 ({@damage 1d4})寒冷伤害。

trait.name: Frostskin
entries: 巫师的皮毛和皮肤被神奇地冻结，形成一个坚硬的屏障。他们的攻击力不能低于16。

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: 信徒的先天法术能力是智慧（法术救赎（%0%），使用法术攻击时命中率+6）。他们可以天生施展以下法术，不需要任何材料成分。

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: 泰尔索尔在依靠听觉或嗅觉的智慧（（%0%））检查中具有优势。

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: 如果 telthor 的盟友中至少有一个人在生物的 5 英尺范围内，而该盟友不在，那么 telthor 在对生物的攻击卷中具有优势（%0%）。

trait.name: Nature Empathy
entries: 泰尔索尔可以指挥野兽，而野兽会一直把泰尔索尔视为盟友。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h} ({@dice 2d4 + 2})穿刺伤害。如果目标是一个生物，它必须在一个{@dc 11}的力量反射中成功，或者被击倒{@condition prone}。
为捍卫自然而死亡的生命有时会留下精神上的回声，即他们自己的幽灵般的版本，以继续他们的工作。
{@b {@i Feywild Echoes.}}这些灵体可能类似于活着的生物，但它们更像是自然界中使用了一点精灵魔法来纪念他们的牺牲。这些灵体实际上没有他们所类似的曾经活着的生物的记忆。
{@b {@i Bound to the Land.}} 泰尔索尔不能离开它所呼应的生物死亡的地方超过1英里远。

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: Thomil可以钻过非魔法的、未加工的土和石头。在这样做的时候，苏米勒不会干扰它所穿过的材料。

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: 该元素对物体和结构造成双倍伤害。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 索米尔进行了两次猛烈的攻击

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw}+{@hit 8}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5})重击伤害。如果目标是一个生物，它必须在{@dc 16}力量救赎中成功，或者被推后10英尺。

action.name: Engulf
entries: Thomil可以选择用猛烈的攻击吞噬它击中的目标。被吞噬的目标必须在一个{@dc 16}的力量投掷中获得成功，否则就会被融化在thomil的身体中。被吞噬的目标是{@condition blinded}和{@condition restrained}，它有完全的掩护，可以抵御thomil以外的攻击和其他效果，并且在thomil的每个回合开始时受到10({@damage 3d6})重击伤害。Thomil在同一时间只能有一个目标被吞噬。如果索米尔死亡，被吞噬的生物不再受到它的影响（%4%），并且可以使用10英尺的移动距离从尸体上逃脱，现有（%5%）。
Thomil's原产于拉什曼最寒冷的地区，也被称为岩灵，是为了保护拉什曼不受敌人侵害而创造或召唤的土元素。他们从腰部开始类似于人形，但他们不是脚，而是坚实的岩石和泥土。托米尔在地底下等待着，一直处于休眠状态，直到他们感觉到威胁并开始行动。
拉希米人既尊重又害怕索米尔人。因为即使他们击退了入侵者，并通常保持他们的边界安全，他们也会惩罚那些不对他们进行适当崇拜的人。贪婪和目光短浅的人最终会发现自己与索米尔面对面站在一起。
在任何类型的采矿作业开始之前，当地人都会请一位Hathran来为土地祈福，并适当地安抚可能处于休眠状态的任何Thomils。

vulnerable.note: from weapons made of wood or stone

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: 在依靠视觉的智慧（（%0%））检查中，乌特拉克人具有优势。

trait.name: Shapechanger (Werebear)
entries: 乌特拉基可以用它的行动来多态化成一个中等或更小的人形或兽形，或者回到它的真实形态。它的统计数据在每种形态下都是一样的。它所穿戴或携带的任何装备都不会被转化。如果它死了，它就会恢复到它的真实形态。只有真正的视觉或类似的魔法才能显示出乌特拉基的真实形态。

trait.name: Regeneration (Troll)
entries: uthraki在夜间的回合开始时恢复10点生命值。如果乌拉基受到银色武器的伤害或被阳光照射，这一特性在乌拉基的下一回合开始时不会发挥作用。只有当乌特拉基在其回合开始时命中率为0并且没有再生时才会死亡。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 乌特拉克人进行两次爪子攻击

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。
{@h}25({@damage 5d6 + 7})的砍击伤害。

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10}击中，范围50/100英尺，一个目标。{@h}31 ({@damage 7d6 + 7})重击伤害。
乌瑟拉基是拉西门周围森林和山脚下的居民。它们看起来是大型的、类似猿猴的生物，披着白色的皮毛，身体的各个部位都有裸露的皮肤斑块。这些夜行的精灵对周围环境有着敏锐的感知：因为它们的眼睛均匀地分布在头部的各个方向。这种特性--以及它们那令人生畏的牙齿和爪子--在它们的任何形态下都具有变形的能力。乌斯拉基人大部分时间都是以变身的形式存在，因为他们的数量正被哈特兰人猎杀到几乎灭绝。

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: 沃迪阿诺伊人对法术和其他魔法效果的救赎有优势。

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: Vodyanoi可以呼吸空气和水。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: vodyanoi进行两次爪子攻击。如果两次攻击都击中一个中等或更小的目标，则目标会被（%0%）（逃脱（%1%））。

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 5}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3})砍击伤害+2 ({@damage 1d4})寒冷伤害。

action.name: Fish Cloud
entries: 当完全浸没在水中时，沃迪诺伊可以召唤一群魔法鱼，占据30英尺范围内20英尺半径的球体。受影响的区域就像在雾云法术的作用下一样，但这些鱼只能被强大的水流驱散。这些鱼不是真的，如果被抓到就会消失。只要vodyanoi像施法一样保持注意力，鱼云就会持续存在，最长可达10分钟。
渔民和在拉舍门水域工作的人经常向当地的沃迪阿诺伊提供鱼和牲畜的祭品，以安抚通常脾气暴躁的费伊。
{@b {@i Underwater Hermits.}}这些沉默寡言的费人总是以老人的形象出现，有着黄绿色的杂乱头发和类似颜色的长胡须。他们瘦长的手臂末端是长着锋利爪子般的指甲的大手。这些生物可以呼吸空气和水，但很少离开他们的水乡。

{@b {@i Watery Control.}} Vodyanoi can affect the waters in which they live and can do so to devastating effect when offended. Most villagers have heard stories of disrespectful fisherman drowning beneath the waters, or entire villages being swept away by suddenly surging rivers. However, these moody fey occasionally will trade water bound treasures for goats, cows, or other livestock, and may even shepherd schools of fish near villages that have treated them well.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Andar ignores nonmagical difficult terrain and any damage caused by nonmagical thorns, spines, or other natural hazards. Additionally, he has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such those created by the entangle spell.

trait.name: Nature's Ward
entries: Andar can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by elementals or fey, and he is immune to poison and disease.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit ({@hit 7} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, 3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

action.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
entries: Andar magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 2 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 5 hours. Andar can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. Andar reverts to its true form if it dies or falls  {@condition unconscious}. Andar can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn.

While in a new form, Andar retains his game statistics and ability to speak, but his AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and he gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that he lacks. He can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in his new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Andar is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Andar typically has the following druid spells prepared:

entries: Among the trusted allies of the hathrans, the ancient treant Stormwind ranks among the highest. Yet even this ancient advisor cannot live forever. A circle of forest druids has emerged around Stormwind, absorbing his teachings and accumulated wisdom to act as defenders of the Rashmeni lands. Leading this circle is Andar Silverbirch, a mountain spirit folk who bridges the human, fey, and spirit world through his leadership.

A traveler in his youth, Andar sought sacred spaces within Rashmen in the pursuit of deep wisdom. His journeys eventually led him to Stormwind. Ancient even among the realms' longest-level people, Stormwind saw promise in the young seeker who had devoted his life to gaining ancient knowledge. Under Stormwind's tutelage, Andar raised a druid circle devoted to the forest, their numbers steadily growing as the years pass.

Exhausted by age, Stormwind feels his time counseling the hathrans is nearing its end. Andar is now tasked as his liaison, going to advise and speak on behalf of the trusted treant. Andar takes this role with the utmost seriousness and, despite the inherent joy of the spirit folk, Andar radiates a serene seriousness that is both comforting and impressive. The forest is being left in good hands.

entries.name: Personality Traits
entries: Andar is wholly devoted to the pursuit of knowledge so that he might preserve and enhance the wisdom of his teacher, Stormwind the treant. Andar sees knowledge as purposeful, not merely a collection of trivial matters. The long-term preservation of nature and of Rashemen dominates Andar's thoughts.

{@b Ideal.} Tradition.Stormwind has long been an ally of the hathrans. His knowledge and might have been a boon to the people of Rashemen. Andar will continue this work through the druid circle he leads.
{@b Bond.} The defense of Rashemen is all that matters to Andar. He is wholly devoted to the sentient beings of the land.

{@b Flaw.} Leading the druid circle and defense of Rashemen has largely taken control of Andar's being. He has become utterly subsumed by his task and finds it difficult to enjoy the company of others. Occasionally, out of an abundance of caution, he sees enemies where there are none and is slow to trust outsiders.

trait.name: Astral Sight.
entries: Bristlebeard can see ethereal creatures.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If Bristlebeard takes 27 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Bristlebeard makes two melee attacks: one with his lightning tusks and one with his thunder hooves

action.name: Lightning Tusks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Thunder Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Lightning Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) lightning damage.

The Ashenwood is a hostile wilderness, though one guardian protects lost Rashemi and those needing saving: Bristlebeard. A dire boar with patches of bright red hair, Bristlebeard was the subject of an awaken spell, which has given him greater intelligence and the ability to listen to the telthors and their ways of communicating. Due to this strange insight, some Rashemi view Bristlebeard as a sort of spiritual oracle, as the telthors know things that mortals do not.

Bristlebeard owes his longevity to a traveler who gifted him with a potion of longevity, restoring his physical prowess and vitality. Such length of years has also honed his fighting abilities,  making him even stronger than a normal boar of his size. His hide bears the scars to prove it, leading some to refer to him as "Bristlebeard Scarstripes". Bristlebeard finds the new title amusing, wondering what title he will gain in the next hundred  years of life.

Bristlebeard is a useful companion for those on the lookout for rare herbs, spices, and other natural ingredients for tinctures and poultices. He is fearless of the Ashenwood, though he understands when to exhibit caution. Just because he knows the layout and what lurks within the Ashenwood doesn't mean that he chooses to provoke it. Bristlebeard is known to root out areas of lost magic, much like his mundane kin find rare truffles.

monster.name: Chaul of Citadel Rashemar

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the chaul fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Chaul is an 18th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). Chaul can cast the following spells:

entries: Chaul, who rules Citadel Rashemar today, is in truth a human durthan who took the power and title of the annis hag Chaul decades ago. None but Chaul herself know this secret.

When the durthan killed Chaul and assumed power, she bound the hag's visage and some of her knowledge and power into a magical mask, allowing her to assume Chaul's persona. While Chaul is attuned to this mask, her true form is concealed from others, impervious even to divination and truesight — she truly becomes Chaul, not relying on mere illusions. Even if the mask is removed, the effect remains so long as she is attuned to it. Chaul is never seen without her mask, and so much does she love her power that it has been years now since she's transformed into her human form.

Chaul has bonded with the vengeful spirits of the Rashemaari who had died during the citadel's fall. Their rage and thirst for vengeance drive her to strike out at the descendants of her enemies, but also drive her in the more honorable pursuit of safeguarding Rashemen at all costs.

Combining this power with her own great magics makes her a fearsome foe, one who aims to one day take Rashemen from its "outdated" protectors. To this end she has a Citadel, an army, and a legion of sleeper agents across the land whom she calls the Children of Chaul and of whose existence none but she are aware.

Chaul continues to build and to create trust among the common people, for the more who think of her as a capable protector of the land, the more willing they will be to serve her as their ruler when the time comes.

entries: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

trait.name: Brave

trait.name: Medium Armor Master

legendary.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The warlord targets one enemy it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of warlord's next turn.

The Iron Lord, also known as the Huhrong, is the highest-ranking male ruler of Rashemen. Placed in power by the wychalaran, he is expected to do what is best for his people. The Iron Lord is responsible for keeping travel between settlements safer and securing the border lands. He is also expected to dispatch soldiers to deal with any raiding monsters in the untamed parts of Rashemen. During times of war, he also serves as warlord.
The current Iron Lord, Mangan Uruk, is a towering individual, standing over six feet tall with a lean muscular frame, natural red hair, brown eyes, and light brown skin covered in freckles.

entries.name: Life Before the Throne
entries: Born to Borivik and Yuldra Uruk, wealthy merchants in the city of Immilmar, Jandar could have led a life of luxury but instead set his eyes on the Iron Lord's throne early in his life. In pursuit of this goal, he trained under the legendary Fyevarra Stayanoga, a famous Ettercap Lodge berserker. After years under her brutal tutelage, he eventually stood before the other berserker's of the Ettercap Lodge, ready to earn his place.

For two days straight he fought every berserker of the lodge to prove he was worthy of being their brother. His association with Fyevarra did him no favors—in fact it was detrimental as many people did not hold back as they might have, knowing how fierce Fyevarra's training would have been. Despite the brutal initiation, he stood triumphant and was welcomed with open arms. Three days of drinking, feasting, and fighting followed his victory.

Despite having joined a Berserker Lodge, in the eyes of the Rashemi he was still not a man until he went on his dajemma. While most people used the dajemma as a sightseeing vacation, the future Iron Lord wanted to strike out as those of old had, fighting monsters and wicked warlords. Gathering together a band of young Ettercap Berserkers, he journeyed to the Anauroch Desert to find legendary foes.

entries.name: Life on the Throne
entries: A decade after he had proven himself a capable warrior and leader among the Ettercap, his lifelong dream came true. A group of Othlor visited him and his family appointing him as the next Iron Lord. The current Iron Lord had disgraced himself by being caught dealing with their most hated enemies, the Red Wizards of Thay.

On his coronation day, the new Iron Lord proclaimed that the Red Wizards would cease to be an issue before his reign was over. Fifteen years later in 1495 DR he is still trying to keep that promise. In conjunction with the Wychlaran and Vremyonni Mangan has spearheaded the magical securing of their borders, along with creation of anti-mage technology to either defend against the Red Wizards or attack them directly if that time ever comes.

trait.name: Bonded Casting
entries: When the wychlaran casts the {@spell freedom of movement}, {@spell spirit shroud}, or {@spell tasha's otherworldly guise|tce} using one of its spell slots, it can choose for the spell to also affect any number of allies within 30 feet. The effect lasts for the duration, with only the wychlaran needing to maintain concentration.

trait.name: Communal Binding (3/day)
entries: Whenever an ally within 30 feet. of the wychlaran makes an attack, damage, or saving throw roll, the wychlaran may choose to add {@dice 1d6} to that roll. The wychlaran can use this ability no more than once per turn.

trait.name: Unweave (3/day)
entries: The wychlaran can cast {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} at its lowest level without using a spell slot or any components. Additionally, if the wychlaran needs to make an ability check as part of targeting a spell of the enchantment or necromancy schools, it can add its proficiency bonus to this ability check.

trait.name: Insect Commune
entries: Mishara can spend 10 minutes to enter a trance and commune with any insect colony within 100 miles as if she had cast the beast sense spell on a willing beast.

trait.name: Irresistible Magic (1/day)
entries: When Mishara casts a spell requiring targets to make a saving throw, she can choose to force all targets to have disadvantage on the saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wychlaran is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It  can cast the following wychlaran spells:

entries: A former follower of Imzel and self-proclaimed durthan, Mishara Viadrova is a powerful wychlaran who turned against the dark order after Imzel's death and the fall of the durthan. For years, she worked alongside the lower ranks of wychlaran, shunned by her fellow casters for her involvement with the dark arts of the durthan. Through years of tireless effort and a spotless record of integrity, goodness, and obedience to the wychlaran, Mishara was slowly promoted through the ranks. Ultimately, she reached the council of the othlor and fell under the tutelage of the aging abjuration specialist, Kovorina Dvilich. Mishara endured a relatively short tutelage at the hands of Kovorina, mastering protective magics and the communal binding capabilities that other wychlaran could scarcely imagine. After Kovorina's death shortly thereafter, the othlor selected Mishara—the only qualified candidate who could replace Kovorina on the council—to join the inner circle of othlor.

When Mishara became an othlor, she carved a new mask in the shape of a wolf's visage: a symbol of her rebirth and the loyal ferocity with which she would protect the wychlaran and Rashemen from the forces of darkness that threatened to destabilize the nation. But every mask has two sides and ultimately acts as a disguise to show the world only what the wearer wishes them to see. While Mishara is dedicated to the protection of the order, she regularly employs contacts from her durthan past and other unsavory magical methods the wychlaran would not approve of in order to ensure the protection of the realm. Her position in the othlor places her above scrutiny, allowing her actions to go unchecked.

Utilizing her communal binding mastery, Mishara has the ability to commune with hundreds and thousands of ants, spiders, and mites across the realm and outlying nations. These creatures act as spies and informants, allowing Mishara to collect seemingly impossible information from even the most secret of conversations. Her mastery of shared spellcasting allows her to cast spells through these insects, whether they are separated by inches or hundreds of miles. With careful focus and expert attention, Mishara secretly intervenes in dangerous situations across the realms; sometimes as a long-distance healer who saves a crucial figure from an expert assassination, other times as the magical assassin who removes a crucial threat to the Rashemi.

Despite her good intentions, Mishara's connections with the underground durthan witches, immense spy network, and access to dangerous and forbidden knowledge act as constant temptations to use her powers for ill. While the othlor's rigid rules and delineation of light and dark magics have historically held the wychlaran together and ensured the safety of Rashemen, Mishara has begun to question, once again, whether these rules are the correct path forward. With ever-evolving magical forces threatening invasion from Thay and the other bordering countries, it is unclear how Rashemen could survive without wychlaran who are willing to skirt the boundaries of magical law and reshape the rules that govern the wychlaran. Mishara's alliances and connections, whether for good or ill, may shape the future of Rashemen; as great powers rise and fall, knowledge is the true magic that holds this nation together.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
entries: If Raustulph fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Raustulph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Ghost Dagger.
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spectral Touch.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage but undead are immune to this damage. Additionally, Raustulph regains hit points equal to damage dealt.

action.name: Shapechanger
entries: Raustulph can use his action to polymorph into either a Medium cloud of mist or his spectral undead form. While in mist form, Raustulph can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. He can hear, see, is weightless, has his usual flying speed, can hover, and can enter a hostile  creature's space and stop there (he usually does). If air can pass through a gap, so can Raustulph in mist form, without squeezing. He has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and is immune to all nonmagical damage except fire damage.

legendary.name: Cast Cantrip.
entries: Raustulph casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Raustulph flies up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Regeneration
entries: Raustulph regains 7 hit points.

legendary.name: Spectral Touch.
entries: Raustulph makes a spectral touch attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raustulph is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). Raustulph has the following wizard spells prepared:

entries: A century ago, a Rashemaar wizard fought a spell-duel across Rashemen against three senior Red Wizards of Thay, all four combatants teleporting across the region as they fought. Raustulph was that mage, and he prevailed in the fray, destroying all three of his foes—but at the cost of his sanity and his life.

Caught in multiple snarling collisions of hostile battle-spells, Raustulph was torn into undeath, and has existed ever since as a fierce defender of Rashemen with a short attention span, a unique spectral undead who can suddenly coalesce out of mist or fog, or arise as mist from any body of water in Rashemen, and ride any wind, from the merest ghost of a breeze to a howling gale. He usually manifests to challenge intruders, unless they can convince him they mean Rashemen no harm.

Raustulph is utterly fearless (for no matter what happens to him, he manifests anew when the next phase of the moon begins), often vanishes as abruptly as he appeared, and if he takes a fancy to adventurers, will often spy on them and reappear repeatedly, whenever they need aid—or when he wants to thwart them.

The mage's spectral humanoid form is that of a legless, floating phantom who can see, speak, and cast spells as he did in later life—that is, hurling magics by calling on the Weave with verbal and somatic components but not needing material components at all.

Today, Raustulph roves Rashemen, concentrating on its border areas, as the self-appointed guardian of the land. He occasionally shows himself and speaks to the matriarchs, but usually acts as a lone wolf, appearing to outlanders and intruders. He is gruff and cantankerous, and all too apt to say such things as "Clowns and jesters are more welcome elsewhere than in this fair land" and "Competent and valiant base liars, are we?" and "You demonstrate a formidable talent for leaping into messes of your own creation" and "It's fortunate for you that I so deeply appreciate the entertainment you provide."

trait.name: Enthralling Performance
entries: If the satyr performs for at least 1 minute, it chooses up to four humanoids within 60 feet of it who watched or listened to the entire performance. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target idolizes the satyr and will take part in the satyr's revels. The {@condition charmed} condition ends for the creature after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if the satyr attacks the target, or if the target witnesses the satyr attacking or damaging any of the target's allies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sleepless Reveler
entries: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The satyr makes two ram attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Outlanders that journey into Rashemen struggle with the customs and traditions of a harsh land. Allies are difficult to come by, but one that can be counted on wanders the shores of Lake Ashane, enjoying jhulid and sjorl, singing tales of the great heroes of old: the satyr Tarhil.

entries.name: Wandering Skald
entries: Always looking for a good time, Tarhil eagerly offers his services to those new to Rashemen who seek a guide, historian, or negotiator. He claims to be in good standing with the nature spirits who dwell amongst the land, favored even by the water spirit of Lake Ashane. Such statements have some level of truth to them due to the magical power Tarhil possesses. His songs and tunes lead to manifestations of the Weave, while other abilities seem to directly connect to magical blessings of the fey. Where these powers come from, and if he is connected to these spirits, Tarhil chooses not to say.

{@b Appearance.} Tarhil appears as a young, clean-faced satyr, with an appearance compared to a young human male. His eyes are a dazzling, otherworldly ice blue, as though blessed by the spirits of Lake Ashane itself. He carries with him the Warhorn of D'yobcire, a sign of his friendship with the Iron Lord. His main choice of musical instrument, however, is a set of panpipes that produce many scales and notes as he tells his tales of the battles fought on the shoreline of the Lake of Tears.

entries.name: Relations
entries: Through his wanderings Tarhil has encountered many legends who dwell within Rashemen. He has spoken with Stormwind, the ancient treant, about things long forgotten. Despite a solid relationship with Stormwind (when the treant is awake), he doesn't always see eye-to-eye with Andar Silverbirch, the treant's new liaison and intercessor. While Andar tends to be more cautious and serious, Tarhil is, like the majority of satyrs, carefree and sometimes flippant.

{@b Iron Lord Ally.} The Iron Lord and his berserker lodges see Tarhil as an ally, as he is known to embrace their feats of strength and endurance with raw gusto when he visits. Those journeying with Tarhil and failing to meet the same standards as the Tarhil find that he becomes a fickle ally, ready to abandon those whose actions can't match their boasting.

Tarhil gives all Wychlaran great respect and deference, going beyond normal traditions, paying them homage with fey traditions of gifting trinkets, secrets, and what some perceive to be garbage and waste.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

For most of their youth Zasvor Temraid lived on the streets of Immilmar. When their magical abilities manifested in their early teens, they were pickpocketing a foreigner and nearly killed the man by electrocuting him. The city authorities quickly detained Zasvor and waited for the wychlaran to arrive. They were ferried away to the Urlingwood to receive the blessings of the spirits before being sequestered. Through this entire process, Zasvor barely spoke a word, stunned that they had nearly killed a man and even more so that they were an Old One.

Very quickly the other vremyonni and wychlaran realized not only were they a quick study of the craft, they were a prodigy pointing out flaws in old designs and ways to improve them. An eldritch engine that laid dormant for half a century was finally activated after Zasvor examined it for a few minutes.

Zasvor's prodigious skills only grew with age until they were looked upon as the most intelligent of all the vremyonni, both young and old. The hathran and othlor's frequently invited them to be a part of the decision-making process when it came to any and everything arcane. Sometime after they reached their

35th birthday, the othlor's blessed them with one of the greatest gifts a vremyonni can be given: longevity. Their lifespan now mirrored that of most elves. With their lifespan greatly expanded, there was nothing they couldn't learn, no great project they couldn't finish. All of Zasvor's time was dedicated to making better weapons of war to defend the Rashemi. Their behavior was that of a fervorous zealot.

It was because of their zealous fervor that their betrayal was all the more devastating. To this day, no one knows what drove them to betray all that they had held dear for nearly two and a half centuries. But one fateful day they turned on their fellow vremyonni, killing a number of them and Siradhal Nyenebotra, a well known hathran that was visiting. Zasvor stole a number of ancient texts and schema before teleporting away.

Three centuries later they are still wanted by the wychlaran. They proved rather elusive, constantly changing their appearance, traveling between demiplanes of their own creation and never staying in one location or plane for any extended length of time.

While Zasvor is constantly moving they have made powerful friends and allies since they've left Rashemen. The knowledge that they took with them has never been shared with any others as far as the wychlaran can tell. Those that come across them and aren't seeking to end their lives can persuade them to aid them if their cause is just or curious enough.

spell.name: Cohort
entries: You perform a ritual of bonding with another willing creature, tethering them to you and your magic. When you cast this spell, you and the target gain the benefits listed below:

items: When you and the target are forced to make a saving throw against the same spell, use either your or the target's result, whichever is higher.
When taking damage, either you or the target can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage type if the other has resistance to that damage.
Spells and features that either you or the target use with a range of touch can target the other, as long as you are within 30 feet of each other and can see the target.

entries: This bonding ends early if either you or the target are reduced to 0 hit points, are ever on a different plane of existence for more than 1 hour, or if you cast this spell again and bond to a different creature.

m.text: two pints of jhuild worth 1 gp each, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can create a permanent bond by casting this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, targeting the same creature every day for one year. After doing so, this effect only ends if you or the bonded creature die.

spell.name: Enrage
entries: You touch a target, bestowing them with a fit of rage. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist this effect. When successful, the target becomes enraged, giving them advantage on any melee attack roll using Strength. Attacks made against the target by other creatures within 5 feet have advantage.

This effect ends early at the end of the enraged creature's turn if they have not dealt damage with a Strength-based attack since the start of their last turn, or if they are reduced to 0 hit points. The target can also attempt to end the effect early by making a Wisdom saving throw at the end of their turn (no action required).

spell.name: Flashburst
entries: You cause a blinding flash of light to erupt around one target creature within range. The target is {@condition blinded} for the duration and must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 round. Additionally, each creature within a 10-foot radius of the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on themselves on a success.

components.m: a pinch of sulfur or phosphorus

spell.name: Moon Blade

m.text: a small candy made with wintergreen oil

entries: You evoke a blazing sword of moonlight into your hand. The moon blade is a simple weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse and light properties. The blade deals an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage to undead on a hit.

Targets struck by the moon blade have difficulty maintaining or casting spells. Creatures have disadvantage on concentration checks made against damage from the moon blade. Additionally, until the end of the target's next turn, targets must succeed on a saving throw using their spellcasting ability to cast a spell, or their spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Placebind

m.text: a drop of water, a plant seed, and an area at least 100 feet in diameter

entries: Over the course of 8 hours, you guide any number of willing creatures in a ceremony that gives them familiarity with the local area. Participants are able to rest or perform other activities during the ceremony, so long as they do not leave the ceremonial circle and as long as you are able to complete a walk along the circle's edge at least once every 2 hours.

Once cast, the effects of the spell allow the participants to use any of their class features or traits that require a specific terrain type, such as a ranger's Favored Terrain or the wychlaran's Place Magic, on the terrain in a 50-mile radius from the spell's casting. The spell's effect encompasses areas above and below ground, but does not extend to other planes of existence.

This spell does not alter the terrain, only the targets' familiarity with it. For example, a ranger with the Favored Terrain of tundra doesn't suddenly find snow in the desert, they simply treat the terrain in the spell's area of effect as favored, regardless of its type. Abilities requiring the presence of specific physical components such as plants or a storm still require those elements.
The familiarity gained through this spell fades when a creature finishes a long rest.

spell.name: Restore Spirit

m.text: firewood, and rare herbs worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a ceremony that cleanses and restores the target creature's'' spirit. The ceremony removes the following harmful effects:

items: Any effect causing the target to be blinded, charmed, deafened, exhausted, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, or stunned
Any curses
Possession
Any reductions to the target's ability scores
Any effect reducing the target's maximum hit points
Any negative effects suffered as a result of casting or being subjected to a raise dead or resurrection spells.
Any effects suffered as a result of Wychlaran Communal Bonding being broken

spell.name: Scatterspray
entries: You target a collection of at least six small unsecured objects located within one foot of each other. The objects can be no larger an apple and collectively weigh less than 25 pounds. You cause these objects to fly off in all directions. Creatures within 10 feet of the objects must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or they are struck by the flying items. If the items are hard or sharp, such as stones, sling bullets, coins, or similar, struct creatures take {@damage 2d8} points of bludgeoning damage. If the targeted objects are softer, such as eggs or berries, the spell deals half damage and creatures who fall to 0 hit points from the attack are not killed, but are unconscious and stable instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shashkah

m.text: a tuft of black wool, a human hair, and a sword

entries: A sword you are holding is imbued with the power of ancient spirits, guiding you in its use. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you are not holding the weapon at the end of your turn.

spell.name: Turn Fiend

m.text: a witch bottle containing salt, an ounce of holy water, and chalk worth 50 gp

entries: You unseal the bottle, and a gaseous mixture fills the air around you. Each fiend of Challenge Rating 1 or lower within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, they are turned for 1 minute or until they take any damage.

A turned creature must spend their turns trying to move as far away from you as they can, and they can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. They also can't take reactions. For their action, they can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents them from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature uses the Dodge action.
At the end of its turn, a turned creature can repeat this saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the Challenge Rating of fiends it can affect increases to 2 or lower. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the Challenge Rating increases to 4 or lower. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the Challenge Rating increases to 7 or lower.

spell.name: Vulnerability
entries: You touch a creature and mark it with a curse of vulnerability. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed. While cursed in this way, the target has disadvantage on saving throws they make to resist your spells.

spell.name: Waterspout

m.text: a piece of grass or seaweed twisted into a coil

entries: You conjure a whirling, cylindrical column of water 10 feet in diameter and 60 feet tall rising up from the ground or a body of water. Creatures within 10 feet of the waterspout must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be sucked into the spout. Creatures in water have disadvantage on the saving throw. Any creature that starts its turn inside the spout takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is grappled by the spout (escape DC equal to your spellcasting DC). Targets are restrained while grappled in this way.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spout up to 30 feet in any direction, provided it stays in contact with the ground or a body of water

default: (a) a {@filter any sword|items|type=martial weapon|property=sword} or (b) {@filter any simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon}
(a) {@filter any simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon} or (b) {@item component pouch|phb}
{@item leather armor|phb}, {@item explorer's pack|phb}, and a wychlaran mask

entries: Caretakers of ancient arcane knowledge, the wychlaran use wisdom and magic to protect Rashemen and guide its people.

entries.name: Spiritual Community Leaders
entries: The wychlaran, or witches as most call them, are the spiritual leaders of Rashemen. They fulfil many of the roles that clerics and druids occupy in other lands, communing with the deities and spirits on the behalf of common folk. Their words are heeded by all, and to disobey one is unthinkable.

entries.name: Knowledge Tempered by Wisdom
entries: The wychlaran are sworn caretakers of ancient Raumathar's arcane knowledge. The empire was known for its battle-wizards, capable of unleashing powerful spells and binding elemental magic into arcane constructs to create great weapons of war. The wychlaran judiciously protect this lore, carefully using these magical secrets in defense of the land.

entries.name: Tradition, Progress, & Heresy
entries: As caretakers of rare magical knowledge, the wychlaran have learned drawing upon divine, natural, and arcane energy in their spellcasting. A secretive few disagree with the conservative use of magic. These "durthans" would use the full extent of knowledge available, including forbidden dark magic, to protect and preemptively strike against the nation's enemies. Wychlaran leaders remain vigilant against such heresy, believing such thinking leads to the same self-destructive path taken by their Raumathari ancestors.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a wychlaran quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Constitution or Intelligence. Second, choose the new {@background wychlaran|rcg} background.

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Wychlaran
entries: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player's Handbook, here's what you need to know if you choose wychlaran as one of your classes.
Ability Score Minimum. As a multiclass character, you must have at least a Wisdom score of 13 to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a wychlaran.
Proficiencies Gained. If wychlaran isn't your initial class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you take your first level as a wychlaran: all swords, light armor.
Spell Slots. You refer to the standard multiclassing rules for the Spellcasting Feature for the purposes of calculating your total spell slots, with the following adjustments:

items: In addition to the listed classes, add all your levels in the wychlaran class for the purposes of calculating your total level.

Instead of using the Multiclass Spellcaster table, you use the Wychlaran Class Table and cannot gain Spellcasting spell slots beyond those listed. This can result in the loss of spell slots from another class with the Spellcasting feature.
You do not gain any additional bonded spell slots as a result of multiclassing.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Wychlaran spellcasting is a combination of learned knowledge and deep connection with spirits and the land itself. The origin of wychlaran arcane capabilities lies in learned magics such as those practiced by wizards but has evolved over time, and has been tempered with wisdom and passed down in oral traditions and complex rituals. While wychalaren have access to a wide breadth of spells, individuals specialize their knowledge and the rituals needed to form a spiritual connection and change their daily spells are more demanding and therefore more limited on a day-to-day basis. See {@book Spells Rules|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the Wychlaran Spells Listing for your {@filter spell list|spells|class=Wychlaran (RCG)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wychlaran spell list|spells|class=Wychlaran (RCG)} spell list, as well as the {@spell guidance} and {@spell resistance} cantrips. You learn additional wychlaran cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Wychlaran Class Table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Wychlaran Class Table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wychlaran spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of wychlaran spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the wychlaran spell list. The first time you do so, choose a number of wychlaran spells equal to your wychlaran level + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one spell). Subsequently, this total increases as your Wychlaran level or your Wisdom modifier increase, but you can only change a limited number of spells on the list per day as described below. Your prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change a number of prepared spells equal to your Wisdom modifier when you finish a long rest, Preparing a new list of wychlaran spells requires time spent in ritual connection with the spirits or with the land: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level wychlaran, you have two 1st-level and one 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells. With a Wisdom modifier of +3, you can change 3 of the prepared spells on the list whenever you finish a long rest, they need not be the same spells you changed the previous day. The first time you prepare spells after leveling up to 4th level, you prepare one additional spell of your choice from the wychalaran spell list.

The Spell Slots Per Level columns indicate the number of spell slots available to cast per long rest, along with any bonded spell slots you may have available. The "+1" on this list represents the number of bonded spell slots available to you.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your witch spells, as your power comes from your study of the dark arts. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a wychlaran spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have it prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use {@item sword|phb}, {@item quarterstaff|phb}, or a wychlaran mask as a spellcasting focus for your wychlaran spells.

classFeature.name: Communal Binding
entries: A wychlaran can perform a 1-hour ritual to create a bond between themself and a number of willing creatures. Excluding the wychlaran performing the ritual, the maximum number of creatures that can be included in the ritual is listed in the Communal Binding column in the Wychlaran Class Table. The Communal Binding number increases only with levels in the wychlaran class.

The communal bond lasts until the lead wychlaran performs a new binding ritual or through death. The communal bond is severed for all bonded creatures if the wychlaran dies, and for each individual bonded creature if they die. The ritual can be performed as part of a short or long rest, so long as the wychlaran does not cast spells while performing it. A wychlaran can't perform the Communal Binding ritual more than once every 24 hours.

When the Communal Binding ritual is completed, each bonded creature, including the wychlaran, contributes a number of d3s equal to their proficiency bonus to a communal pool. These dice are used when invoking the communal bindings' effects (see below) and tracked by the wychlaran who performed the ritual. The pool replenishes fully once all bonded creatures have completed a short rest.

The Communal Binding is a spiritual event and not considered magical, and is not affected by {@spell dispel magic} or similar effects. The communal pool is destroyed if the lead wychlaran dies or participates in a new Communal Binding.
{@b Communal Pool Uses}

items: As a bonus action on their turn, any of the bonded creatures can remove one die from the communal pool and add it to their next attack roll, damage roll, or ability check. They must choose the die's use when it is taken from the pool, and before rolling the pool die.

As a reaction when one of the bonded creatures makes a saving throw, that creature and/or the lead wychlaran who can see them can remove one die (each) from the pool and add it to the saving throw. They must do so after the saving throw has been rolled, but before determining the result.
As long as there is at least one die in the communal pool, a wychlaran can add that die to any saving throws made to maintain concentration without expending the die.

entries: {@b Multiple Wychlaran}

No creature, including a wychlaran, can be part of multiple bindings. A wychlaran can be part of a binding performed by another wychlaran; in this case, only one communal pool is formed, and it is controlled by the wychlaran leading the ritual. The binding of a second wychlaran increases the pool die size from d3 to d4, and the binding of a third wychlaran to a d6. Additionally, multiple wychlaran can never have the same Communal Channeling option active simultaneously within the same Communal Binding.
{@b Severed Bonds}

items: When a communal binding is severed as a result of the lead wychlaran's death, all participants suffer a {@dice 1d3} penalty to their attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and cannot participate in another Communal Binding until they finish a long rest. The communal pool is also destroyed.

When a communal binding is severed as a result of a bonded creature's death, only the lead wychlaran and that creature suffer the {@dice 1d3} penalty, but neither party suffers any Communal Binding restrictions.

classFeature.name: Bonded Casting
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can extend the benefits of certain spells to those you share a Communal Binding with. Casting in this manner is more strenuous than working normal spells, and only specific spells and separate spell slots can be used for Bonded Casting.
When you use Bonded Casting on your turn, you can take no other actions, bonus actions, or reactions during that turn.

When you use Bonded Casting to cast a spell targeting a creature with whom you share a Communal Binding, you may choose for that spell to affect any number of other creatures that are part of that Communal Binding.
{@b Bonded Spell Slots}

The Wychlaran Class Table shows how many bonded spell slots you have to cast your wychlaran spells of 1st level or higher. These spell slots can also be used for regular casting, but your regular spell slots cannot be used for Bonded Casting.

You regain all expended bonded spell slots when you finish a long rest. You can never gain more bonded spell slots than is listed on the Wychlaran Class Table, and items or features which add or restore spell slots do not add or restore bonded spell slots unless specified.
{@b Bonded Spells}
The Bonded Casting Spells table shows spells that can be used for bonded casting. You always have these spells prepared and they do not count against the number of spells you can prepare.

entries.caption: Bonded Casting Spells
rows: {@spell guidance}, {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell healing word}, {@spell shield of faith}

entries: {@b Bonded Recovery}

Once per day, when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended bonded spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wychlaran level (rounded up).
For example, if you're a 4th-level wychlaran, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

classFeature.name: Communal Channeling
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your action to channel energies among those who are part of your Communal Binding, and are within 30 feet of you when the channeling begins. The channeling lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or you use an action on your turn to end it. When you begin channeling, you choose one of these options:

items: Commanding Channeling. You take tighter control of the Communal Binding. For the duration of the channeling, only you can use dice from the Communal Pool. Once on each of their turns, other creatures within the Communal Binding can deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier to a creature or creatures damaged by one of the bonded creature's spells or attacks.

Protective Channeling. You raise the defenses of the bonded creatures. When you begin channeling and at the start of each of their turns, this feature grants temporary hit points to all other creatures that are part of your Communal Binding. The number of temporary hit points is equal to your Communal Binding number. When a creature loses these temporary hit points, you take psychic damage equal to half your Communal Binding number, rounded down. If multiple creatures lose these hit points simultaneously, the total damage you take is capped at your Communal Binding number for that instance. Damage you take from Protective Channeling ignores resistance and immunity, but does not cause you to make saving throws to maintain concentration.

Psychic Channeling. You form a strong telepathic connection with the bonded creatures. For the duration of the channeling, all creatures within your Communal Bond can communicate telepathically, regardless of distance. The connection formed enables the affected creatures to perform more complex maneuvers by giving them awareness of what their comrades are about to do. Additionally, as a bonus action on their turn, a bonded creature can use the senses of another bonded creature instead of their own until the end of their own turn. For example, a human can gain a dwarf's darkvision.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis
entries: At 3rd level, you choose the set of teachings and customs you practice in your daily life as a wychlaran. The choice of praxis informs all aspects of your powers, from additional spells you learn from spirits, to how you lead your communal binding, to the way you use constructs. The Praxis of Tradition is the time-honored path for most hathrans, while the Praxis of Power is the nonconformist path typically taken by durthans.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Place Magic
entries: Starting at 5th level, you are able to draw on the magic of the land itself to help you cast your magics. While you are located in Rashemen, you can cast any wychlaran ritual spell without having it prepared.
Additionally, once per short rest, you can cast one wychlaran spell you don't have prepared using an appropriate spell slot.

classFeature.name: Unweave (1 use)
entries: The years of resistance and opposition to the Thayan wizards have taught the wychlaran to combat magic.

Starting at 6th level, you can use your action to cast {@spell dispel magic} at its lowest level, or your reaction to cast {@spell counterspell} at its lowest level, without using a spell slot, any components, or having the spell prepared.

Additionally, if the spell or effect you are attempting to unweave is of the necromancy or enchantment schools and requires you to make an ability check as part of casting {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell counterspell}, you can add your proficiency bonus to the ability check.
You may use this feature once and regain any expended uses when you finish a short rest. You gain additional uses of Unweave at 9th and 13th levels in this class.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain another feature from your Praxis.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Unweave (2 uses)
entries: You gain an additional use of Unweave at 9th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Repurpose Construct
entries: Starting at 10th level, ancient Raumatharian knowledge of constructs allows you to make use of existing constructs. When you defeat a construct and it is not entirely destroyed, you can attempt to magically re-purpose it to serve you. You can't attempt to repurpose a construct with a Challenge Rating greater than half your wychlaran level (rounded up).

The repurposing attempt takes 1 minute, during which you must remain within 5 feet of the construct and can't cast any spells. At the end of the minute, make a Wisdom (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 plus the construct's Challenge Rating. On failure, the construct is not re-animated and can't be targeted by this feature again.

On a success, you gain control of the construct, with the following changes: the construct no longer has its knowledge or personality, it has only half of its average hit points and can never regain hit points by any means short of a wish spell. It has an Armor Class 2 points lower than listed in its stat block. The construct acts immediately after you in initiative, and can move, dodge, and use any reactions on its own, but taking other actions requires you take a bonus action to command it to do so on its turn.

The construct is held together by magic and falls apart after 8 hours or earlier if you repurpose a different construct. Additionally, it can be destroyed by the {@spell dispel magic} spell or similar effects as a spell equal to its Challenge Rating.
Once you've successfully repurposed a construct, you can't do so again until you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Unweave (3 uses)
entries: You gain an additional use of Unweave at 13th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Wychlaran Praxis Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain another feature from your Praxis.
